content:
A. with girded loins   B. with shoes on feet 
C. with staff in hand  D. raw 
E. remnants the following morning. 
 
7. For rebelling against Moses and God, the Israelites 
were bitten by the fiery snakes. The cure for the snakebites 
was 
A. a drink of the water from the rock 
B. anointing the affected part of the body with 
oil 
C. to call on the name of Yahweh 
D. a herbal preparation by Aaron 
E. a look at the bronze serpent. 
8. Joshua was appointed to lead the Israelites to the 
Promised Land because 
A. Moses was too old to lead them there 
B. the Israelites preferred Joshua to Moses 
C. Moses never returned from Mount Sinai 
D. of Moses’ rebellion in the wilderness of Zin 
E. he was a powerful soldier. 
 
9. The covenant was renewed on Mount Sinai because 
A. there was a new generation which did not 
remember the first 
B. the people had taken part in Korah’s rebellion 
C. the people had demanded water from the rock 
D. Aaron had made a golden calf 
E. the people had wanted to return to Egypt. 
 
10. Those inspired by God to lead the tribes of Israel in 
battle were the 
A. judges B. captains of the Guard 
C. priests D. prophets E. Levites. 
 
11. Each of the spies sent out by Moses on God’s command 
to report on the nature of the Promised Land was a 
A. great warrior B.  wise Judge C. priest 
D. Levite E. leader in his own tribe. 
 
12. God revealed to Samuel that he was going to punish Eli 
because he 
A. did not correct his sons’ sinful behaviour 
B. did not offer sacrifice as the law required 
C. did not warn the people of Israel to stop 
sinning 
D. warned his sons but did not punish them 
E. offered sacrifices to other gods. 
 
13. The sun stood still when 
A. Moses led the Israelites out of Egypt 
B. Jericho fell to the army of Joshua 
C. Noah came out of the ark 
D. Joshua defeated the Amorites at Gideon 
E. Moses came down from the mountain with 
the table of the law. 
 
14. ‘I repent that I made Saul king’. What incident does 
this refer to? 
A. The anointing of Saul 
B. When Saul failed to pray 
C. During Saul’s encounter with the Ammonites. 
D. When Saul was offering sacrifice to God. 
E. When Saul disobeyed God over Amalek. 
 
15. David’s first reaction after he had been rebuked by 
God through the prophet Nathan for his sin against 
Uriah and with Uriah’s wife was to 
A. beg for forgiveness 
B. plead with God to preserve the life of his child 
by Uriah’s wife 
C. request that the punishments threatened by 
God would not come to pass 
D. ask Nathan to beg Uriah’s wife to pardon him 
E. simply wait for whatever God would bring on 
him. 
 
16. ‘If he (Baal) is a god, let him contend for himself 
because his altar has been pulled down’. Who pulled 
down the altar? 
A. Moses B. Joshua 
C. Gideon D. Samson E. Joash 
 
17. Hannah prayed to God at Shiloh for a son because. 
A. Elkanah hated her for being barren 
B. Peninnah provoked her sorely 
C. She had sinned against the Lord 
D. She had only daughters 
E. She wanted her son to succeed Eli. 
 
18. God pronounced utter destruction on the Amalekites 
because  
A. they were hostile to the Kenites who lived 
among them 
B. they were hostile neighbours of Isreal like the 
Philistines 
C. Saul desired to acquire the Amalekite territory 
D. they opposed Israel on their way from Egypt 
to  the promised land 
E. God wanted to wipe out every element of Baal 
Worship in Canaan. 
 
19. As David was about to die, he charged Solomon to 
keep God’s statutes, commandments, ordinances and 
testimonies, so that he, Solomon, might. 
A. prosper and the Davidic dynasty be preserved 
forever 
B. receive his father’s blessing 
C. have children who would succeed him 
D. avenge the enemies of David 
E. complete the temple project. 
20. In the trade treaty between king Solomon and Hiram of 
Lebanon, Solomon was to supply wheat and oil while 
Hiram was to supply. 
A. grains only B. precious stones 
C. wheat and oil D. timber E. silver 
21. To whom was this addressed? 
‘Your father made our yoke heavy. Now therefore lighten 
the hard service of your father and his heavy yoke 
upon us and we will serve you’. 
A. Jeroboam B. Nebat 
C. SolomonD. Rehoboam 
E. Ahijah 
22. ‘I have been very jealous for the Lord, the God of hosts’ 
for the people of Israel have forsaken thy covenant, 
thrown down thine altars and slain thy prophets with 
the sword; and I even I only, am left; and they seek my 
life to take it away. ‘ This was said by 
A. Jeremiah before the Temple 
B. Elijah at a cave in Mount Carmel 
C. Moses at a cave in Mount Horeb 
D. Elisha at a cave in Mount Nebo 
E. Elijah at a cave in Mount Horeb
